info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 9 at 11:27PM EDT until July 10 at 8:17AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware...
White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County.
For the White Clay Creek...including Newark...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White Clay Creek near Newark.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 13.6 feet. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.3 feet on 06/27/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 830 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING
